definitions.definition: A nobleman in England, France, and Germany, of a rank next below that of duke , but above a count . Originally, the marquis was an officer whose duty was to guard the marches or frontiers of the kingdom. The office has ceased, and the name is now a mere title conferred by letters patent or letters close .
Any of various nymphalid butterflies of the Asian genus Bassarona (or Euthalia ).

main_definition: A nobleman in England, France, and Germany, of a rank next below that of duke , but above a count . Originally, the marquis was an officer whose duty was to guard the marches or frontiers of the kingdom. The office has ceased, and the name is now a mere title conferred by letters patent or letters close .
secondary_definitions: Any of various nymphalid butterflies of the Asian genus Bassarona (or Euthalia ).
